meanings.definition: Loud and persistent outcry or demand.
meanings.sent1: The clamours of the protesters could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The clamours of the children playing in the park filled the air.
meanings.sent3: The clamours of the hungry puppy for treats were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The clamours of the storm outside matched the chaos in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The clamours of the sirens made it impossible to ignore the emergency.

meanings.definition: A loud and confused noise, especially that of people shouting.
meanings.sent1: The clamours of the crowd at the concert were exhilarating.
meanings.sent2: The clamours of the market on a busy day were overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The clamours of the students in the cafeteria created a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The clamours of the city streets blended into a symphony of urban life.
meanings.sent5: The clamours of the fans filled the stadium with excitement.
